sn16.13:3.1: 13 The Counterfeit of the True Teaching
sn16.13:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn16.13:4.3: Then Venerable Mahākassapa went up to the Buddha,
sn16.13:4.4: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn16.13:4.6: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why there used to be fewer training rules but more enlightened mendicants?
sn16.13:4.7: And what is the cause, what is the reason why these days there are more training rules and fewer enlightened mendicants?”
sn16.13:4.8: “That’s how it is, Kassapa. When sentient beings are in decline and the true teaching is disappearing there are more training rules and fewer enlightened mendicants.
sn16.13:4.9: The true teaching doesn’t disappear as long the counterfeit of the true teaching hasn’t appeared in the world.
sn16.13:4.10: But when the counterfeit of the true teaching appears in the world then the true teaching disappears.
sn16.13:5.1: It’s like true gold, which doesn’t disappear as long as counterfeit gold hasn’t appeared in the world.
sn16.13:5.2: But when counterfeit gold appears in the world then real gold disappears.
sn16.13:5.3: In the same way, the true teaching doesn’t disappear as long the counterfeit of the true teaching hasn’t appeared in the world.
sn16.13:5.4: But when the counterfeit of the true teaching appears in the world then the true teaching disappears.
sn16.13:6.1: It’s not the elements of earth, water, fire, or air that make the true teaching disappear.
sn16.13:6.2: Rather, it’s the foolish people who appear right here that make the true teaching disappear.
sn16.13:6.3: The true teaching doesn’t disappear like a ship that sinks all at once.
sn16.13:7.1: There are five detrimental things that lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
sn16.13:7.3: It’s when the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen lack respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the training, and samādhi.
sn16.13:7.4: These five detrimental things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
sn16.13:8.1: There are five things that lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
sn16.13:8.3: It’s when the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen maintain respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the training, and samādhi.
sn16.13:8.4: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
sn16.13:12.1: The Linked Discourses with Kassapa are complete.
